clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Cohort Study of Pneumonia in Respiratory Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Cohort Study of Pneumonia in Respiratory Intensive Care Unit

brief_summary.textblock: From 2003 when Severe Acute Respiratory Syndromes (SARS) appearedï¼Œmany new types of respiratory viruses emerge in endlessly. Therefore, the epidemiology and the clinical character has changed quietly, especially severe pneumonia. This cohort study aim to obtain the contents of severe pneumonia patients in Respiratory Intensive Care Unit (RICU). Through the clinical data analysis, the investigators could get the information of the pneumonia caused by different reasons, such as morbidity and mortality, risk factors, clinical symptoms and radiographic changes, the respiratory support parameter and so on. The investigators hope the result could guide them do the clinical work of severe pneumonia better in the future.

primary_outcome.measure: the mortality caused by any reasons in RICU
the morbidity caused by any reasons in RICU

secondary_outcome.measure: the symptoms description of pneumonia caused by any reasons in RICU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the first 48hours after admitted in RICU
secondary_outcome.description: all the symptoms caused by pneumonia, such as fever, cough, dyspnea, sputum and so on. The investigators could get the incidence of each of these symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: the respiratory support of pneumonia caused by any reasons in RICU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the first 5 days after admitted in RICU
secondary_outcome.description: summarize the respiratory support parameters while the patients hospitalized in RICU. For example, the ventilation parameter and mode, Whether the mechanical ventilation complications occurred, and so on.

secondary_outcome.measure: the treatment options of pneumonia caused by any reasons in RICU
secondary_outcome.description: the investigators obtain the treatment commons, such as the kind of antibiotics, the dosage of glucocorticoids, etc.

arm_group.description: The patients admit in RICU because of pneumonia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- admit in RICU because of pneumonia of any causes
- anticipated length of hospital stay more than 72h
Exclusion Criteria:
- admit in RICU because of other causes except pneumonia
- do not agree to join this study
- admit in RICU for the second time
- anticipated length of hospital stay less than 72h
